TEXT.citation: Indigenous Languages Research and Development Foundation. (2020). 族語E樂園. https://web.klokah.tw/

S.FORM: djavadjavai a masantalj. patagilj anga.
qacalji! i cungali.
djavadajvai sinsi.
kana venalai sinsi
qiladji.
qiladju.
djavadjavai a masantalj.uri temulu a ken a nu sinsi tua patjara kakanen, sa anemaya a penayuanan?
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的排灣語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say Paiwanese for food.

S.FORM: pulingalingaw sun tua ku sinitulu?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: kemeljang sun tua anemayamaya ken a su sinsi?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi, ini aken a pulingalingaw. pai qaqivuanan a puita.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ini a ken a lemadenga, pai tja pasiqacauana?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: pacunu a pasamaza! kicuali a ken a semupu a puita.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: nanguaq aravac a tja sinupuan.
pai kituluanan a puitanga. tja pasiqacau ananri.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: maliceng. maya kiljavadran.
kalicengu, maya qivu.
pai alapu a nu laqulj.
ui, sinsi.
pai alapu a nu inepic.
sinsi, madraudrav a ken a kemacu tua ku inepic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: sinsi, ini a ken a paqenetj a kemacu tua ku inepic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: pai alapu a nu siquliqulip.
sinsi, madraudrav a ken a kemacu tua ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: sinsi, ini a ken a paqenetj a kemacu tua ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: pai kisedjamu tua su sapitjan tua siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: pasedjami a ken tua su siquliqulip ui?
semu-a anga men tua nia kitulu.
qemacuvung anga men tua kitulu.
djalju mazai tua tja kitulu, cevucevungi anga nu tjaivililj tua pulavai.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: tima sun?
ti Qipu a ken.
tima sun?
aljak a ken ni Sedjam, ti Qipu a ken.
S.TRANSL: I am Sedjam's son and my name is Qipu.

S.FORM: tima sun?
vencik a ken ni sinsi i Puljaljuyan, ti Qipu a ken.
S.TRANSL: I am a student of Puljaljuyan and my name is Qipu.

S.FORM: tima su ngadan?
a ku ngadan ti Qipu.
tima ngadan ni tjama?
pinaka tima ti tjama?
a ngadan ni kama pinaka ti Sedjam.
a ku kama ti Sedjam.
tima timadju?
ti Bua timadju.
u kaka a uqaljai a tjavulung tjanuaken timadju, ti Bua timadju.
S.TRANSL: He's my brother, his name is Bua.

S.FORM: tima ngadan nimadju?
ti Gese timadju
ti Gese a ngadan nimadju?
pinaka ti Gese timadju?
ui, pinaka ti Gese timadju.
ti Apung a ngadan nimadju?
ini, a ngadan nimadju ti Apang.
tima azua?
ti Aljui timadju. ku kina ti kinai Aljui timadju.
tima azua?
ku drava timadju, ti Ipi a ngadan nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Ipi。
She's a friend of mine, her name is Ipi.

S.FORM: pidanga a su cavilj tucu?
tapuluq anga ku cavilj tucu.
pidanga a cavilj nimadju tucu?
tapuluq saka drusa a cavilj nimadju tucu.
pidanga a cavilj ni tjama tucu?
limapluq anga a cavilj na ku kama tucu.
mapida a su siruvetjek?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: mapida mun a mare kakakaka?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: izua madrusa a tjavulung tja nu aken a ku kaka a uqaljai katua vavayan, sa macidilj a tjaljaljak tja nu aken ku kaka a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: izua a su kaka a tjavulung tjanusun a uqaljai?
neka nu ku kaka a tjavulung tjanuaen a uqaljai.
malje pida mun a tacemekeljan?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: izua men a ma sepatj a tacemekeljan.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: i tulutulu sun i zainu?
i tulutulu a ken i Taihuku.
tima timadju?
ku kama timadju a siruvetjek ni kama.
anema a kipusengesengesenganan ni tjama a siruvetjek ni tjaina?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: kisacu timadju.
tima azua?
ku kaka a vavayan a tjavulung tjanuaken timadju.
izua sengesengan ni su kaka a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: kipusengesengesengan timadju i biyuing.
mare suruvetjek tiamadju?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: ini, mare qali tiamadju.
paiyuan sun?
kacalisiyan sun?
ui, paiyuan a ken.
paiyuan a su cekelj?
ui, ljakua se Bunun zuku timadju.
qacaqaca ti tjama?
ui, qaqacaqacan amen a tacemekeljan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: ma gakkuku anga su kaka a vavayan a tjaljaljak tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: ui, ma gakkuku anga timadju.
saiqu a penaiyuana a su kaka a tjaljaljak tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: ui, saigu tiamadju a penaiyuanan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: mapida a su siruvetjek?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: izua ma tjelu a ku siruvetjek.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: na matevelj a su kama katua su kina tua umaq?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: ui, namatevelj a ku kama atua ku kina.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: na kiatevelj sun tua su vuvu a uqaljai katua vavayan?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ini, ini a ken a nakitatevelj tjayamadju.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: tima su kiniteveljan?
na kitatevelj a ken tjai kama, tjai kina, ktua ku kaka a tjavulung tjanuaken a uqaljai.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: na kemasinu sun?
na kemasi Akaw a ken.
inuan a nu umaq?
a nia umaq i Akaw.
inuan a su qinaljan?
i Akaw a ku qinaljan.
inuan a su qinaljan?
i Akaw a ku qinaljan.
tuki nungidanga a su sisaumaqan?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: nu kaljapulavayan tua zulezulan maumaq aken sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: aljak aken na kacalisiyan.
namakuda a qadaw tucu?
qadavan anga, zemulezul aravac.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: ljemaljeqljeqel a icasaw?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: ljamaljeqel aravac, sa itungu a pakaliyaw.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: zemulezulezul a icasaw?
ini, venalivali anga, sarenguanguaq aravac.
namakuda a kinaqadavan tucu?
inika ljaljeqeleqel inika zemulezulezul, sarenguaq a racac.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: namakuda sa kinavenginan tucu?
neka nu qerepus, mapacucun anga a vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: namakuda a kinaqadavan nua i casaw?
tjaumeljai, maqadaw anga, sa tjevuta anga a quljivangaraw.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: tjau maka qudjalj, sa maqadaw anga, sa puquljivangaraw anga.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: namakuda a kinaqadaqadavan i tjanumun?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: venalivali aravac imaza i tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: namaljenguaq a kinaqadavan i tjanumun?
nanguaq aravac, maqadaqadaw.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: uri vaik anga ken a kitulu.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: ljemaljeqel aravac, sa itungu a pakaliyaw.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: uri casaw anga ken.
ki qemudjalj a paljaqaca nu sauni, paqenetju a masi ljaung.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: uri qemudjalj?
cemlalalalaq anga, ki qemudjalj nu sauni.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: qemudjaqudjalj anga?
na qemudjalj ta sauni, sa meljai anga tucu.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: qemudjaqudjalj anga?
matu na qemudjalj anga, tjevetjeveng a djalan.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: na qemudjalj? Aqu sun a tjevetjeveng a penulingelingetj?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: qemudjaqudjalj a i casaw, ini aken a namasi ljaung.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: namakudanga sun?
kemudakudanga sun?
paljaqaca aravac sa vali, lemutud a ku qulu tua ku kinipavalian.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: namakudanga sun?
maqadaw aravac, vucengel a ku qulu tua ku kinipaqadavan.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: dremaudraw anga ken a kemacu tua inepic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: malim anga ken a kemacu tua inepic.
ku pasedjamai sun.
dremaudraw anga ken a kemacu tua qecap.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: malim anga ken a kemacu tua qecap.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: ini aken uta a nakemacu, ari veli-i.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

S.FORM: ari veli-i tua inepic ui?
S.TRANSL: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: vaiki a veneli tua inepic ui?
S.TRANSL: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: nanguaq, sa uri veneli anan aken tua siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: ui, sa uri veneli aken uta tua siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: ari veli-i tua tja kenamain ui?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: tjuari, na kenama anga ken i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.

S.FORM: dremaudraw anga ken a semeljec tua bintu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: malim anga ken a semeljec tua bintu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: sau seljecu a kirimu.
vaiku a semeljec a kirimu.
dremaudraw anga ken a kemacu tua bintu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: malim anga ken a kemacuc tua bintu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: pai tja kanaw a ku bintu numaya.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: anema uri su cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: uri anema a su kinecengeljen?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: uri keman aken tua sinancengelj nua gakku.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: anema uri su cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: uri keman su tua nema tua cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: nakemasi cenglj a ken tua bintu tucu, pai kaljingulji a kincengelj!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: vaiki a menali tua lanciyu ui?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: nanguaq! Ari.
vaiki a menalji tua pangciyu ui?
ini, inika ken a vaik, uri kitulu aken.
pai alapan aken tua suapan.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: ui, ku sivayan cu a suapan tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: pai alapan aken tua zuking ui?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: semuasuap ana a ken, alapan aken ayau ti Adrang.
S.TRANSL: B: I'm sweeping the floor and you asked Adrang to get it for you.

S.FORM: na makasuap anga sun?
maka suap anga ken.
aqu sun a inika semuasuap?
maka suap anga ken.
kungai aravac a kasintalj, sau zukingu.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: ui, vaik aken a malap tua zuking.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: kungai aravac azua qezung, sau zukingu.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: galju anan, inikanan a ken a makasuap ta imaza.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: uri kemuda sun nu sauni?
anema uri su kudain nu sauni?
uri vaik aken a kipakim tjai sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: anema su kudain nu qemacuvung itjen tua tja Kitulu i gakku?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: uri kemuda sun nu maka kitulu itjen i gakku?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: uri vaik aken a semenai katua ku qali.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: uri kemuda timadju nu qemacuvung tua kitulu?
uri vaik timadju a ljemangui.
i tjumaq ti Ljavaus?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Ljavaus is at home?

S.FORM: itjumaq timadju, kelju saqumaqanu.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: i tjumaq ti Cankim?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Cankim is home?

S.FORM: neka, Inika i tjumaq timadju, pai anema su pacugan?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: tima?
vuvu, ti mani aken.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I'm Mani, please open the door.

S.FORM: tiam?
Teludj, ti Giljegiljaw a ken, kipakikim aken tjanusun a Ki vangavanga.
S.TRANSL: Teludj, I'm Giljegiljaw and I've come to play with you.

S.FORM: a i singidan anga sun?
cuacuai anga itjen a inika mapacucun.
uilja! Nasingelit anga ken tjanusun. Kelju pareqaqivui!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!

S.FORM: pai qiladju, tekelu tua utja.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: pinakalevan.
pai tekelu tua utja.
ua! Sanguaq aravac a nu utja.
kelu kani tua kudamunu!
ui nanguaq! Matu sanguanguaq cu a marka kudamunu nu tja pacunan.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: sanguanguq a kudamunu?
ui, sanguaq aravac.
maka kesanga ti kina tua kaiven, kelju kanu!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: ui, vaik aken a pilima.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: inika sun a zuma, maya pakiljivak tua keman tua temkel.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

S.FORM: inika sun a qaliqali, su liavu a kema su qacau a temkel.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

S.FORM: nasemuliyaw aken a ravac a keman, mavetu anga ravac.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I'm full.

S.FORM: suliyavu a keman, maya pakiljivak.
ui, sanguaq aravac a paqulid.
uri vaik anga ken, kivalanga ken tjanusun nu Tjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

S.FORM: ui, cevungi anga a mumalj.
masulem anga ravac, uri tjumaq anga ken.
kivaljau anga nu tjaiviljilj dri!
pangetjezu anan nu tjaivililj a kivala dri!
galju anga i djalan.
ui, kivalavalau a matjanuamen nu pucug sun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: djavadjavai a masantalj, tucu uri kacuin mun ni sinsi a vaik a kivalja tua marka ramaljmaljeng i qinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: ui nanguaq! uri ki qaqivuan amen tua marka ramaljemaljeng a penayuanan.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說排灣語。
Okay! We have to speak Paiwanese to the seniors.

S.FORM: uri djemaljudjaljun anga itjen?
uri djemaljudjaljun anga.
vuvu, mangtjetj amen a ljemilji tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: na! saigu mun a penayuanan! nanguaq aravac!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說排灣語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: djavadjavai a masantalj, tucu uri kacuin mun ni sinsi a sema tua pu vaquan a murisengsengan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: ui, sinsi.
kelu samazau a marasudj, paqenetju a kemacu a nu sipurisengsengan.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: ui, sinsi, niya kinacu anga nia sipurisengsengan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: djemaljun anga itjen?
ini inkanan a djemaljun, cemadja anan.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: sau djiqesu.
sau djiqesu tua zaljum.
ui, tiaken nai a djemiqes.
sau alapu tua sivilavilad tua qayaqayam.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: ui, vaik aken a venilad tua qayaqayam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: djavadjavai a masantalj, uri vaik itejn a sema tua pu qemuziquzipan tucu.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: ui! Nanguaq aravac! uri pakatanema itjen a vaik?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: uri maka Basu itjen a vaik.
kacumalii a masantalj, uri veneli anga itjen tua kippu.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ui.
a i sangas mana pu qayaqayaman, a i tjaivililj mana pu qatjuvian, sa tjarapacucuni tua marka nemanga.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: sinsi marekutj aken tua qatjuvi.
inika makuda, sau pacunu tua qayaqayam numaya.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: nu cemalivat anga tua ita a zikangan samazai anga a matevetevelj.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: ui, pinakalevan sinsi.
anema su pinacunan tucu?
napacun aken tua liyaw a qatjuvu, sa izuanan a liyaw a qayaqayam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: adjeljuayu, uri vaik anga itjen. pakirimu, uri vaik anga itjen.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: kaljavau anan aken, mazeli arava a ku kula.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: vaiki a ljemangui ui?
ui nanguaq! ari!
tjuruvu aravac a caucau a ljemanguljangi imaza.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: qaca aravac a zaljum i zua, nanguaq a tjaljumaza itjen a ljemangui.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: na maka tua anema sun a mangtjez?
na djemavac aken a mamaza.
a nema su pinakavavavan a mangetjez?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: na maka tua basu aken a mangetjez.
uri pakatua anema sun a sema kiyukai?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: uri unting ti kama sake pivavai a vaik.
maka tua anemanema timadju a magakku?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: maka vavavavaw tua jiyin timadju a magakku.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: maka tua anema a su vuvu a vavayan a veneli tua ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: maka utubai timadju a vaik a veneli ta ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: uri maka tua anema sun a sema Tau?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: uri maka tua varukur aken a sema Tau.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: uri maka tua anema timadju a sema Tau?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: uri maka hikuki timadju a sema Tau.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: uri maka tua anema timadju a sema Takau?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: uri maka tua kauti timadju a sema Takau.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: namaka kisiya timadju a sema Taitu?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ui, namaka kisiya timadju a sema Taitu.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: namaka kisiya timadju a sema Taitu?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ini, namaka hikuki timadju a sema Taitu.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: izua a ljaljevavavan tua basu a makamaza?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: izua, ljiazuau anan a pagalju ki su pacuni a ljaljevavavan tua basu.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: izainu a tjaljacunguan tua ljaljevavavan tua jiyin imaza?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: neka nu ljaljevavavan tua jiyin imaza, amin a maka haiya sun.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: ki makudakuda a maka tua basu sa djalun i gakku?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: ki izua 15 nu pung a zikangan sa djaljun i gakku.
ki makudakuda nu zikangan a maka tua kauti sa djalun i Taiciyu?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: ki izua 1 nu zikangan.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: cuai a pasa Ulai nu unting tjen?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: ki maya izua 1 nu zikangan.
ki makudakuda nu zikangan nu maka tua jiyin sun a sema tua nia umaq?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: ki izua 20 nu pung a zikang.
saigu sun a maka didinsiya?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: saigu sun a maka tjukutjuku?
saigu aken a maka didinsiya.
izua su utubai?
izua ku utubai a ita.
izua su utubai?
neka nu ku utubai.
makaya sun a ku ki susuan?
makaya ken a kivadaq tjanusun?
makaya, namasilevan aken aravac.
ui, pukaui aken.
makaya sun a ku ki susuan?
makaya sun a ku kivadaqan?
inika makaya, kedri a ku kineljangan.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: pucug sun nu masukincengelj? pasa vaik a ken a kivala tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎？我想去拜訪你可以嗎？
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: nganguaq, ku kaljavaw sun i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: pucug sun nu tiyaw? pasa kisusu aken tua patjara tja milimilingan a payuan.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎？我想請問你關於排灣族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Paiwan tribe.

S.FORM: uri sema gadu aken nu tiyaw, inika ken a i tjumaq dri!
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: na seladenga ken tu kemeljang sun aravac tua patjara sinankakudan nua payuan zuku, sa uri pasakivadaq a ken tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對排灣族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Paiwan people, so I would like to ask you something.

S.FORM: kedri a ku kinljangan, ljakua ki ku sipasemalaw a ku kineljang.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: djavadjavai aki makaya ken a paiga tjanusun? ulja sika tjasaceqalja a pu sivecik nu tjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎？這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: ui, inika makuda.
pai pidanga su cavilj tucu?
izuanga a sivapuljuq saka alu anga ku cavilj tucu.
kakedrian anan sun.
kedri anan a su cavilj.
ini anemanai, ramaljeng anga ken aravac.
na kemasinu sun?
na kemasi Pucunug aken.
se payuan a su cekelj uta?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是排灣族人嗎？
Is your wife also a Paiwan?

S.FORM: ini, se Amais timadju.
masan pidalj a kai a su kinasaigu a qivu?
saigu a ken a penayuanan katua kai nia se Amis.
S.TRANSL: 我會說排灣語和阿美語。

S.FORM: namasi levan a ken a kisusu tjanusun tucu, pai qaqivu, nanguaq sun a pasemalaw tua patjara sinan palisi tua patjanu qemaljup ui?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎？
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: ui nanguaq. Ka maqacuvucuvung anan a ken vaivaik a ken a murisacemel a sema vukid.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常到山林打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: pinakalevan, nanguaq aravac a su sinitulu tucu.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: namasan paqulid angata a ku siniqaqivu, mana sinitjaucikel nua mareka tja vuvu.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: uri tja tjaljumaza anga a tja kaljavar. pinakalevan aravac a su sinitjaucikel.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: inika makuda, tja cusuaw anga nu tjaivililj.
uri vaik anga ken, ulja tjaliyaw anan a ku ki tjaucikelen nu tjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: nanguaq! Galju anga.
navenala sun, anema su velin?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: uri venli aken tua kuppu tu ita.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: navenala sun, anema su velin?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: uri venli aken tua tjalupung tu ita.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: uri venli aken tua kuppu, izua nu sipaveliveli?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎？
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: izua, uri pida su velin?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: paveliveli mun tua saviki?
neka, inika men a paveliveli tua saviki.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: venli a ken tua padai.
uri tjanu pida a su velin?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pavai a ken tu tjanu tjelu a cavu.
uri veneli a ken tua vurati.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: mapulat anga a velin a vurati.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: uri venli a ken tua tjanu drusa a qalew.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: tjanu ita anga imaza tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: sau velian a ken tua qacilu.
pida tjingtjingan a su velin?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pida nu tjingtjingan a qacilu tua su velin?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: uri drusa tjingtjingan a ku velin.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: veneli a ken tua drusa djaljengan a kucai.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: tjelu anga nu djaljengan imaza, nisun anga penuljat.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: pida cu a padai?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: drusai dai a tacavu.
drusapuluq saka tavatan a penuljat, sa pumaya i drusanga puluq.
pinakalevan.
siva puluq saka lima vatan a imaza.
veneli anan a ken tu kedri, ulja madjaljun a taitai.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: limai dai saka tapuluq a penuljat.
pai ulja limai dai anga a ku sivai ui?
pazangal cu aravac, makaya a papemadjuluin?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎？
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: inika maqati, pinaka madjulu angaravac aicu
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: uri ku alapen cu a piyapiya.
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: tjelu a pulu cu a piyapiya, sa izuanan a su kinasalinga?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎？
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: makaya ken a kisedjam tua su paisu?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ui makaya! makudakuda a su kisedjamen?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: maljim anga ken a masipaisu, makaya ken a kisedjam tua su paisu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎？
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ini a ken a namasi paisu auta!
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: dremaudrav anga ken a kemasi paisu, maqati a ken a kisedjam tua su paisu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎？
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ini a maqati, a su kinisedjam ka sitjaisangas a paisu inikanan a su valiti a ken.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: makaya a ken a kisedjam tua su itung?
makaya, sau alapu tisun a macidilj.
makaya a ken a kisedjam tua su laqulj?
ku sinipasedjam anga tjai Vais.
pasedjaman tjanuaken a su tjukutjuku ui?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: ui nanguaq, ljakua pacikelu anga nu tiyaw tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: qemudjalj anga, ini aken a namasi kausua, pasedjami a ken tua kusua ui?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎？
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ita a kausua a ku kinacu, tja kiljaljaungai!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧！
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: aicu a su sinipasedjam ka tjaisangas a ljaqulj tjanuaken, ku pacikelaw tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: sa pacun anan sun tua anema nu ljaquljan makaya ken a su pasemalavan.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: ki nungida ken a venalid tua su paisu?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: inika makuda, valitu anga nu izuanga su paisu.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: nungida anga sun a semu kiyam tua ku paisu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: ku sukiyamai anga sun nu tiyaw. ku valitai anga sun nu tiyaw.
S.TRANSL: I will return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: nungida anga su pacikelen a ku ljaqulj?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: ku pinacikel anga tjatiyaw tjanusun ayaken?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎？
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: sini pasedjam cu a inepic ni Kasi tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: Did Kasi lend you this pen?

S.FORM: ui, ku kinisedjam tucu tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: su kinisedjam cu a inepic tjai Kasi?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Kasi?

S.FORM: ini, vineli cu ni kina.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: nekanga nu qatia, sau kisedjamu tjai Balu tua qatia.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, let's borrow some from Balu.

S.FORM: ui, vaik a ken a kisedjam.
sau sukiyami a ku paisu ayau ti Saunuyaw.
S.TRANSL: Go and ask Sauniyaw to return my money.

S.FORM: pida a kiyam nimadju tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: mainu sun?
vaik a ken a sema puljacengan a temalem tua ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: kemudakuda sun ? anema su kudakudain?
cemecemel anga aravac, ljemivaljivas a ken, sa uri ku djiqesen anan nu sauni.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: pai alapan a ken tua tjakit katua kudra ui?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎？
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: su pininu?
ku pinipaqadaqada tua kakara.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: su vinatjukan anga qipu?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: tjau ku vatjukan, ki tjukudan nu sauni.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: makayanga a ki ljacengan a su sinitalem?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎？
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: makayanga cu a kiljacengen a kadrupung, azua a samaq inikanan a makaya a kiljacengen.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的山萵苣就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: ua! Ljiyaw anga ravac a su kinivurati.
S.TRANSL: 哇！你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: pusaladji a ken a pasa kubaw ui?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: kemudakuda mun?
anema nu kudakudain?
pu amiami amen a kicciqaw.
S.TRANSL: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: liyaw a ciqaw i maza?
liyaw anga a kini ciqaw a pinipidrur.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: kemudakuda sun nu kiciqaw?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: paka tua vukevuk a ken a kiciqaw.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: saigu sun a penanaq a qemaljup?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: pudringadringai a ken a djemameq tua sacemel, sa izua nu masi kuang a masi vatu a ken uta a qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: pinaka zuazunan cu nua vavui.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: pinaka sinan djalan cu nua vavui.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: aku susikeljang?
pinaka zuanan cu nua vavui, manasika paka zuazunan cu nua vavui
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: adri tjaljiljiyaw a tja dringai, matu nadjemameq anga tua sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: aku susi keljang?
matu semqu anga a vatu. Ari tja kidjadjalanai.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

S.FORM: anema cu a su sanayanayain?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西？

S.FORM: aicu mana sinan dringai tua paqezetj ta qacailjai, sidringadringai tua kulavaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: anema zua su pinizua?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西？
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: azua mana sidringadringai tua paka ta kula a calis, mavan nu niaya sidringadringai tua takec.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: maleva itjen tua papuluqem nua tja vuvu, ljiyaw a tja qadaw tucu.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: maleva itjen tua papuluqem nua tja vuvu, liyaw a tja kinisacemel.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。

S.FORM: uidri! tja kacuaw a pakaleva a semaqinaljan.
S.TRANSL: 是啊！我們帶回部落好好分享吧！
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: tucu a qadav uri tuluan itjen ni sinsi tu kemuda qivu tua penayuanan na qemuziquzip.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的排灣語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Paiwan language today.

S.FORM: tucu a qadav uri tuluan itjen ni sinsi tu kemuda qivu tua penayuanan na cemuvucuvuq.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的排灣語怎麼說。

S.FORM: tucu a qadav uri tuluan itjen ni sinsi tu kemeda qivu tua penayuanan na kudamunu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的排灣語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Paiwan language today.

S.FORM: maya taqed!
maya qivu!
maya keman ta kakanen!
alapu a su laqulj.
alapu a su inpic.
alapu a su vaveci’en.
saqetju a su laqulj.
saqetju a su inpic.
kipualangai a su kakanen.
kipualangai a su vangavangan.
nima cu a inpic?
nia’en.
nima cu a laqulj?
ni Udung a laqulj.
nima cu a siquliqulip?
inika ken a ’emeljang.
a ni Udung azua itung?
ini, ni Sauniyav cu a itung.
sinsi, inika nakemacu aken ta laqulj.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: kisapitjanu tua su ljaqediqedi a pacun.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: maveceluq anga ’u inpic.
ku pasedjamay sun tua inpic.
maulav anga ku siquliqulip.
ku pasedjamai sun tua ku siquliqulip uta.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser too.

S.FORM: qemacuvung anga tja kitulu, kinemenem itjen i djalan pai!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: ui, masalu sinsi.
uri qemacuvung anga tja kitulu, pai cevucevungi anga nutiav.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，明天大家再見囉。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: ui, vaik anga ken sinsi.
djavadjavai a masantalj, ti Sauniyaw a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is sauniyaw.

S.FORM: navenala sun Sauniyaw.
djavadjavai a masantalj, ti Vais a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Vais.

S.FORM: navenala sun Vais.
navenala sun, ti Udung a ’u ngadan.
navenala sun Udung, ti Ljumeg aken.
navenala sun, ti Kuliw aken.
navenala sun Kuliw, ti Akai aken.
tima sun?
kina ken ni Api, ti Tjuku aken.
tima sun?
kaka aken ni Api a tjaljaljak a vavayan, ti Vais a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 我是Api的妹妹，我的名字是Vais。
I am Api’s sister. My name is Vais.

S.FORM: tima timadju?
ku sinsi timadju, ti Kuljelje a ngadan.
tima zua?
ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay timadju, ti Sedjam a ngadan.
a ti Apang timdju?
ui, ti Apang timadju.
a ti Drangadrang sun?
ini, ti Camak aken.
tima ti Apang?
tiaken ti Apang.
tima ti Uljing?
ku qali ti Uljing.
tima ngadan na su kaka a tjavulung a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: ti Tjuku a ngadan na ku kaka a tjavulung a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Tjuku.

S.FORM: tima ngadan na su kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: ti Vais a ngadan na ku kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Vais.

S.FORM: a kemeljang sun ta ngadan nimadju?
alja ngadan nimadju ti Apang.
pida anga a cavilj na su kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: tapuluq saka lima anga a cavilj nimadju tucu.
pida anga a cavilj na su kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay tucu?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: lima anga a cavilj nimadju tucu.
a izua nu gakku i qinaljan?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: izua.
izua sun tua nu i qinaljan a gakku a kitulutulu?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ui, namaya men tua tacekeljan i gakku a kitulutulu.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: tima zua a uqaljay?
ku ama timadju.
tima zua a vavayan?
ku kaka a tjavulung a vavayan.
tima zua a kakedriyan?
ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay.
anema sengesengan nitjaina?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: sivitai timadju.
anema sengesengan nitjama?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: sinsi timadju.
a su kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay timadju?
ini, qali na ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay timadju.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: a su kaka a tjavulung a vavayan timadju?
ini, ku kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan timadju.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: mapida tiamadju a tacekeljan?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: malje lima tiamadju a tacekeljan.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: mapida nu aljak i tjumaq?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: masepatj a nia aljak.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: mapida mareka su kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka nu ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay, izua matjelu a ku kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: mapida mareka su kaka a tjavavulungan a uqaljaqaljay a vavayavayan?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka nu ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: mapida mareka su kaka a masantalj?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: ne’a nu mareka ku kaka.
a mare kaka mun?
ui, ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay timadju.
a se kacalisiyan mun?
ui, se kacalisiyan amen.
a se paiwan zuku timadju uta?
ui, paiwan zuku timadju uta.
namakuda a kinaqadavan tucu?
ljemaljeqel a pagalju a kinaqadavan, temekel itjen tua linalja.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: namakuda kinaqadavan tucu?
paruzemulezul tucu a kinaqadavan, semuqaca itjen a temekel tua zaljum.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: namakuda kinaqadavan i casav tucu?
mezangal aravac a qadav, paqenetju a iljaljaung.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: namakuda kinaqadavan i casav?
nakemelebav, inika mapacucun a qadav.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: namakuda kinaqadavan nutiav?
neka nu qadav nutiav, uri nakemelebav, mezangal a vali.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: namakuda kinaqadavan tuazua qadav?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: uri naljemaljaqel, emuba itjen a casav.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: namakuda kinaqadavan nu pulavalavai?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: uri namaljenguaq a qadav nu pulavalavay.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: a uri qemudjalj tuazua qadav?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: ui, uri maljenguaq a qadav tuazua, inika uri qemudjalj.
S.TRANSL: 是的，那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: a uri qemudjalj tuazua qadav?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: ui, uri qemudjalj tuazua iqadav.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: a qemudjaqudjalj tucu?
nameljay anga, qemadaqadav anga.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: a qemudjaqudjalj tucu?
qemudjaqudjalj anga, inika ken a nakemacu ta kausua.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: a qemudjaqudjalj a i casav?
neka nu qudjalj tucu, nu masukincengelj kiqemudjalj, kemacu itjen sakamaya tua kausua.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: nu icavilj a kaljaljeqelan atu’i uri ljemaljeqel kemuda?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ui, uri ljemaljeqel aravac nu icavilj, emitung itjen a pakaliav.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: tucu a cavilj a kaljazulzulan ’atui uri zemulezul?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ui, uri zumelezul aravac, semuqaca itjen a temekel tua zaljum.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: tjengelay sun tua kaljavevean?
tjengelay aken tua kaljavevean, sarenguaq a vali.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: tjengelay sun tua kaljauraman?
inika ken a tjengelay tua kaljauraman, ru vali a kaljauraman pai.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: inika ken a paqenetj anga kemacu tua laqulj.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: isapitjan aken tjanusun a pacun.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: inika ken a paqenetj anga a kemacu tua siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: ku pasedjamay sun.
inika sun a paqenetj anga kemacu tua inpic?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: ui, pasedjami aken tua inpic ui?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: anema uri su cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: uri keman aken tua minpau.
anema uri su kaiven?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: uri keman aken ta kinsa.
anema uri su kenamain?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: nakeman anga ken tua qacilu.
anema su kinan ta su cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: nakeman anga ken ta vutjulj na kuka.
ari vaiki a seman mali.
vaivai’u, ku kimavanga nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: ari vaiki a emave’av/ljemanguy.
ui nanguaq angata! ari kaciyuri.
ari vaiki a seman mali.
sikuda, vaiki anan a semakuc tua laqulj.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: namenuremur anga sun?
inianan, semenasenav anan aken tua ’isi.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: namenuremur anga sun?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: namenuremur anga ken.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: nasemenav anga sun tua ’isi?
nasenav anga ken tua ku ’isi.
awa inika sun a napilima?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: pilima anga ken nusauni.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: kemudakuda sun tasauni?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: nakemin aken tjai sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: uri kemuda sun nu qemacuvung itjen tua tja kitulu i gakku?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: uri puntalj aken a tjumaq.
uri kemuda timadju nu qemacuvung tua tja kitulu i gakku?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: uri vaik a iyugi timadju.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Ljumeg, i tjumaq sun?
ui i tjumaq aken, saumaqanu a ’irimu.
Ljumeg, i tjumaq sun?
neka ti Ljumeg i tjumaq! ti Vais aken, kemuda aya sun? ku qivuav anga ti Ljumeg nu mangtjez i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: Ljumeg不在家耶!我是Vais，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Ljumeg。
Ljumeg is not at home. I am Vais. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: a tima mun?
vuvu, ti Ljumeg kati Vais amen, pai suqeljevi a paljing!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Ljumeg和Vais，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Ljumeg and Vais, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: tima?
ti Vais aken, kemikim aken tjai Kuljelje.
S.TRANSL: I am Vais, I am here for Kuljelje.

S.FORM: vuvu, mangtjez aken a kivala tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: sicuayan anga su pinangtjezan, nasengelit anga ken tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Vais, ari vaiki a kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: Vais, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: saumaqanu a kirimu, cuayanga ken a kiljaljavaljava tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: avan cu a ku sinitalem a vurati, paqayamu a keman pai!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: avan cu a qaljemeqem a vurati.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: idu! paqayamu a keman tua ku sinitalem a kudamunu.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: qaljemaqem aravac ca kudamunu.
qiladju! paqayamu a keman tuca ku sinitalem a puday!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: uwa! avancu a qaljemaqem a puday.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: a keman sun tuca tjianes?
inika ken a maqati a keman tua tjianes, avan a pingku a keman aken.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: a keman sun tua piyapiya?
ui, tjengelay aken a keman tua piyapiya.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: ku sitjuljaan sun tua kudamunu tua su kanen.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: masalu, avancu a puqetim a kudamunu.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: ku sialapan sun tua zaljum tua su tekelen.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: masalu.
suliavu a keman, napakaliav aken a seman djamay.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: u! salum sasanguaq angata.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: suliavu a keman, liav anan a kinsa imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: saka inika ken na uri malumalj!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: suliavu a keman, liav anan a imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: nasemuliav anga ken, inika ken a maqati anga patjaizua a keman.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: tucu a qadav uri kacuin mun ni sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: liav a cacalag i gade aya ti ’ina.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: tucu a qadav uri kacuin mum ni sinsi a sema vavua.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: a vaik itjen a temuvulj ta qipu?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: uri sema inu itjen tucu a qadav?
uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema pana.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: uri sema inu itjen tucu a qadav?
uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: a uri sema pana itjen tucu a qadav?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ini, uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: a uri vaik itjen a sema gade tucu a qadav?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: ini, uri vaik itjen a sema vavua tucu a qadav.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: sinsi, anema uri tja pacunan i pana?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: vaik a pacun tua quljicacenglav.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, anema uri tja pacunan i gade?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: vaik itjen a pacun tua kadjiadji.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: uri kemuda itjen a sema vavua?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: uri vaik itjen a pacun tua tja sinitalem a puday, kinemnem itjen tua sasiq, tjainan pai!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema pana a emave’av/ljemanguy?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: ini, uri vaik itjen a pacun tua quljicacenglav.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema vavua a temalen tua ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: itjen a vaik a temuvulj ta qipu.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: izua a minlayalayap a quljicacenglav.
tjaupacun aken tua qaqulidan a valjualjut a quljicacenglav.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: izua a minlayalayap a kadjiyadji.
yi! wa! tjengelay aken aravac tua kadjiadji, bulay aravac.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: uzai a za minlayalayap a kadjiadji.
inika kadjiadji azua, tjainan azua.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: tjimazau a pacun, maya vaivaik a sema cadja yu!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: ui, inika men a uri vaik a ljiacadja.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: inika tjen a mekekelj, gemalju itjen a djemavac avan a se’ulilj sun.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: pasa pakirimurimu aken a pacun.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: anema uri su pakazuanan a sema tapav?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: unting aken ta sidusiya a sema tapav.
anema uri pakazuanan a sema biyuing nimadju?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: djemavac timadju a sema biyuing.
anema uri su pakazuanan a sema bukutu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: maka hikuki aken a sema bukutu. maka hikuki aken a sema bukutu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: anema uri su pakazuanan a sema bukutu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: uri maka gungkang aken a sema bukutu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: anema uri su pakazuanan a tjumaq?
uri maka kisiya ken a tjumaq.
anema uri pakazuanan ni Sauniyaw a sema gakku?
S.TRANSL: How does Sauniyaw go to school?

S.FORM: uri maka kisia ti Saniyaw a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: Saniyaw goes to school by train.

S.FORM: anema uri pakazuanan ni Api a sema kiyukai?
S.TRANSL: How does Api go to church?

S.FORM: uri maka palidring ti Api a sema kiyukai.
S.TRANSL: Api goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: a namaka Jiyin sun a sema gakku?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: ini, uri maka basu aken a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: a namaka palidring sun a sema gakku?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ui, namaka palidring aken a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: a namaka kauti sun a sema Takav?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ui, uri maka kauti aken a sema Takav.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: a namaka kisiya sun manu namaka hikuki sun a sema Kacedas?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: a namaka kisiya sun manu namaka hikuki sun a sema Taitu?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?

S.FORM: namaka hikuki aken, tja djaljav a maka hikuku tua kisiya.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: a namaka basu sun manu naunting sun tua haiya a sema kiyukai?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: naunting aken tua haiya a sema kiyukai, tja djaljav a unting tua maka basu.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: a djemet a siyubai tua nu umaq?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: inika djemet, maka utubatubai aken a sema siyubai.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: a djemet a iyubingkiyuku tua gakku?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: djemet, djemavac itjen satje djemaljun.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: a djemet a kakanan tua tisaba?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: djemavac itjen a palamu satje djemaljun.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走一下就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: a pucug sun tucu a qadav?
kemuda?
pasa vaik aken a kivala tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: izua ku saliman tucu a qadav, avanai anga nutjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: sa izua su zikang nutiav? nutiav a masukincenglj ku imav anga.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: maqati a nutiav, pai ku kiljaljavai anga i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: a maqati aken a lemuing? uri puvecik aken.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: maqati! inika makuda.
a maqati a semasing?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: inika ken a bulabulai, inika namapalimasudj a i papunemangamangan uta, mayanan wa!
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦！
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: pasasing aken numaya.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: aladji auta pasasing.
masalu tua maqati aken a kivadaq tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: inika makuda, anema su sikivadaq?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: ku kivadaqay anema su sengesengan ta maqacuvucuvung sun?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: kisacu aken tasicuayan, ljakua na taigu anga ken tucu.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: saka izua su sengsengan tucu?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: i gakku aken tucu a kipusengsengan.
a i qinaljan a su aljak auta?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ini, i rizuk a ku aljak.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: saka macidicidilj sun imaza?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: izua ku paquziquzip a vatu a ita katua qayaqayam a ita, namaya tua ku sikatacemekeljan tiamadju.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: izua ku paquziquzipen a ita a ngiyav auta, nu izua qemuziquzip a tja saladj inika tjen a masepelj.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: pasakivadaq aken tua paatjanu palisi nua qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: inika liav a ku kinljang, ljakua aza ku inljangan maqati ken sakamaya temevela.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: azua nu siqaljuqaljup a sauzayan anema zua a palisi?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: azua nia siqaljuqaljup a sauzayan inika maqati a vavayan a idjadjas.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: saka a maqati a vavayan a qemaljup?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: nakuya, inika maqati a vavayan a qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Itjing, neka anga nu tja vawa i tjumaq, sau viliyu.
S.TRANSL: Itjing，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Itjing, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: izua anan a tjanuita i esan, mayanan a veneli!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: inika qacuvung a tjanuita, vaiku sakamaya a veneli tu tjanudrusa.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: veneli aken ta vawa, a paveliveli mun?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: izua! pakatjanupida sun?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: veneli aken tu tjanudrusa, sana veneli anan ta paday tu tjanuita i lubuk.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: izua a paday imaza, anemanan a uri su veliin uta?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: kinaveneli anan tua qacilu, a izua nan a qacilu?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: makapaveli anga men tua qacilu.
uri veneli aken tua itung uta.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: namakuda su katjnglayan a itung?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: uri veneli aken ta itung a hansudi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: aicu a qudjidjilj a itung, pakananguaq sun?
a izua anan a zuma a quljav?
izua anan a vuqavuqalj katua cangiangiya a quljav.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: avanai azua cangiyangiya a ku veliin.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Puljaljuyan, nakasinusun tasauni? navaik sun a undu?
S.TRANSL: Puljaljuyan你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Puljaljuyan, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ini, navaik aken a pusaladj tjai vuvu a paveli tua ljacung.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: ai manumaya, izua su zikang nu qazemetj? pangtjezu anga kaiv.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: inika maqati, uri vaik aken a veneli tua itung.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: vaik aken a kiciyur tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: navenala sun, pidapida cu a itavatjuan a ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: drusapuluq a itavatjuan.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: pidapida cu a vurati?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: nu ita tjingtjingan tjelu a puluq.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: paveli aken tu drusa vatjuan ta ljaceng katua ita tjingtjingan a vurati numaya.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Cumai, inika ken a paqenetj anga kemacu tua inpic, a maqati a su pasedjaman aken?
S.TRANSL: Cumai，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Cumai, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: neka nu ku inpic, ni Keljeng cu a inpic.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Keljeng’s.

S.FORM: sa’a maqati a su pasedjaman aken a palamu? ku pacikelav anga nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: ui nanguaq, alapu.
masalu, masalu ayau anga numaya ti Keljeng.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Keljeng for me.

S.FORM: anema su kinasaljinga?
uri pacikel aken tuca drusa a laqulj.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: ui, anema anan auta?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: uri kisedjam anan aken tua tjelu a laqulj.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: ui pai. nu makatjelulj paqenetju a pacikel.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: inika na su pacikel tua siquliqulip tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: ku pinacikel anga tatiav.
nauwa, awa nekanga azua ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: aigu su sinipasedjam anga tjai Api.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Api?

S.FORM: inika ken a kemeljang. vaik aken a kivadaq tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: ku sipasedjaman anan a ku siquliqulip tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Keljeng, a ti Kuljelje a napasedjam tjanusun tuca uba?
S.TRANSL: Keljeng, did Kuljelje lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ini, vineli cu ni ’ina tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: pailja mamav ca nu uba kati Kuljelje.
S.TRANSL: Kuljelje’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: qecengecengel a uba nimadju, maretimalji a quljav na nia uba.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Paules, a nakisedjam sun tjai Cumai ta paisu?
S.TRANSL: Paules, did you borrow money from Cumai?

S.FORM: izua, uri ku cugan timadju tucu a qadav, manu inika ken a paqenetj anga kemacu tua paisu.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: saka nungida su cugan timadju?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: nutiav tjara ku cugi timadju.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ui ku qivuavanga numaya ti Cumai.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Cumai for you.

S.FORM: azua bisangay tja pudringayan ta qecev, azua padjavatan tja pudringayan ta seluc avanazau ququlidan.
S.TRANSL: 田鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: manumaya, pacevacevak aken! djaljepan inika ken a djemamadjamaq.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: ku tuluwai anga sun a mumalj tuazua masanmusalj tu kemuda semanaya.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: wa! penakaleva aravac! nu pudringay aken nutjaivililj tjara iken a makadjamaq anga.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: qaqacan anga ravac alja cemel i vavua, sau alapu ta drukudrukung a ma ubav, itjen a vaik a mavavua.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: pininu a dru’udru’ung?
izua i ljaqediqedi ta dradra’uyan, nu semaumaqan sun ta ubav isupacuni.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: kinemenem itjen a malap, avan a mavuciq sun, radjai aravac a dru’udru’ung.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷，鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: inika tja djuladjulatan a ku dringay!
izainu a su dringay?
izua i patekuteku tuazua kasiv.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: awa susipaqenetj?
ku pinukeljangan a pimaza, kemeljang aken tu ku pininu a dringay.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: rumue aicu, tja sikiciqaciqav cu a mapana.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: neka nu nia rumue, nu kiciqav amen avan a sipanadinadip a izua.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: inika napavala a semeljudj tua sipanadinadip, tului anga ken nutjaivililj ui?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ui lja! ari vaiki anga nutjaivililj a panadip.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: saka ku tuluwai anga nutjaivililj tua seman rumue.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: milalualuag anga su panadip, tjara izua anga ciqav a namakelai! pakirimu a remakac.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: galjuanan, midradruqai aravac ca vare’ur. tjimazaken a remakac tua panadip, sau sazuau a malap tua ami.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: rakacu a pasa maza alja ciqav, ku pusaladjai anga remakac.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊，我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: aitja nanguaq auta! napakaliav itjen tucu a qadav, namapeljuq anga ca tja purur.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: pai cikeli a kirimu sa tja pangapangalji a masantalj.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: uzianga ti sinsi.
mayanga kivangavang, kirimu qiladju a sema tua su qiladjan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: djavadjavay, sekavililj anga aken!
saumaqanu.
sikamasan pidalj a qadav tucu ta tapulavayan?
sikamasanlimalj tucu a qadav, pulavay nutuav, ari kivangavangi!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: ui! vaiki a sema pana.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: sikamasan pidalj a qadav nutiav ta tapulavayan?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: sikamasantjelulj nutiav ta tapulavayan, vaikianga seman mali nu masukincengelj!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: anema uri su salima nutiav a kadjamadjaman?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: pulavalavay nutiav, uri vaik aken kati kina a sema kiukay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: makuda sun?
pasa mutjaq aken, vaik aken a sema binziyu.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: mavengav a ku qulu.
kitjuqemu anan a kisuzelian.
sinsi, saketju a ku tjialj, vaik a ken a sema binziyu.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: ui, pakirimu.
a maqati aken a sema binziyu?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: uri, qemacuvung anga tja kitulu vaiku anga nusauni.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, saqetju a ku qulu, pulavay aken nu numasukincengelj.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: ui, kinemenemu nu tjumaq sun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi, uri pulavay aken nu tjaivililj ta sangasangasan na tapulavayan, vaik aken a kipucemel.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: ui, kanavenalavalau.
izainu ti Muni?
saqetjuqetju a tjialj nimadju, sa izua timadju i binziyu.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: izainu ti Puljaljuyan?
sinsi, saqetjuqetju a liqe ni Puljaljuyan, sa napulavay tucu a qadav.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Puljaljuyan has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: akua inika namangetjez ti Muni?
masezasezam timadju.
kipasemalavu tjanusun.
ti Tjanubak a lja Tjaluigi aken, tapuluq anga ku cavilj tucu.
S.TRANSL: My name is Tjanubak Tjaluigi, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: tima su ngadan?
ti Tjanubak a lja Tjaluigi a ken.
aljak sun nua nema zukuan?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: aljak aken nua paiwan zuku.
a kacalisian a mareka su sikatacemekeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ui, paiwan zuku amen a tacekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是排灣族人。
Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.

S.FORM: a kacalisian a mareka su sikatacemekeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ini, paiwan zuku a ku kama, pairang a ku kina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是排灣族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: nima sun a aljak?
aljak aken ni Camak a lja Tjaluigi.
S.TRANSL: 我是Camak a lja Tjaluig的小孩。
I am Camak a lja Tjaluig’s child.

S.FORM: a su kama azua? pida anga cavilj nimadju?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: unem a puluq anga cavilj nimadju.
a su kama azua? pida anga cavilj nimadju?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ini, nia ramaljemaljeng timadju i qinaljan, alu a puluq anga cavilj nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pida anga cavilj nua su kaka a tjavulung tjanusun a uqaljay?
tapuluq saka alu anga cavilj nua ku kaka a tjavulung tjanuaken a uqaljay.
a liav a cavilj a sikatjavulung tjanusun nua su kaka a uqaljay a tjavulung tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: lima cavilj a nia didaq.
maudauda a su kinaqaca?
taiday saka sepatj a puluq a ku kinaqaca.
aiyanga sun, nameqacanga sun ui?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ui, taiday saka tjelu a puluq anga ku kinaqaca.
namekudral anga sun ui?
ini, pacevak a su sipacunan.
namekuljay anga sun ui?
ini, namekudral anga ken.
namekudral anga sun ui?
ui, tjelu a puluq anga ku kinasadjelung tucu.
uri semainu sun?
vaik aken a sema kakizuanan a kipusalima nua sinsi a kemim tja sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: uri semainu ti Puljaljuyan?
uri vaik a veneric tua cemel.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: inu ti Puljaljuyan?
izua i ljaljanguyan timadju, uri malalumalj ta ljemanguy timadju nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: inu ti Muni? uri malalumalj ta mekelj timadju nusauni.
S.TRANSL: Muni在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Muni? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: izua timadju ta kakateveteveljan, ku vaikav a qivu timadju.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: pay ari sa vave’asani.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: vaik anan aken a veneli ta ku cengelj, ku kimav anga sun nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: pay ari tja qaluav a tja bintu!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kimu ta zuma, uri vaik aken a kemim ta sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Puljaljuyan a uri malalumalj tucu ta cuitjiu?
S.TRANSL: Is Puljaljuyan competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: ini, uri malalumalj ta ljemiuvu.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: nu undukay tuazua i qadav a izua uri su kicapiljen?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: izua, uri kisaseljang aken tua malalumalj ta makelj.
nu undukay tuazua i qadav a izua uri su kicapiljen?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri kisaseljang aken tua malalumalj na cuitjiu.
uri kemuda itjen nu undukadukay i qadav?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri malalunalj amen tua maqaqesir.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: a uri paveli tjen tua kakanen nu undukadukay?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ini, uri paveli amen tua tjabulubululj.
sangasangasan sun, tjalja ma’ayan!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: masalu.
a izua i tjumaq ti vuvu i vavayan?
izua,na taqed i qarengan timadju.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: a izua i tjumaq ti vuvu i vavayan?
neka, tjau vaik a casav, nu qazemezemetjang kimangetjez.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: a izua i tjumaq ti vuvu i uqaljay?
uzai i tjaivavau sau kimu a sema vavau timadju.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: a izua i tjumaq?
ti Puljaljuyan, sicuayan anga ku pinacunan tjanusun, na venala sun?
S.TRANSL: 是Puljaljuyan阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Puljaljuyan. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: na venala ken! kemim aken tjanusun a maljavar.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: inu a su kama?
seman djamadjamay i kakesan timadju, ku vaikav a qivu.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: na vaik anga semainu ti Muni?
vaikanga sema pukukan a djemekep ta kuka timadju.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: vuvu i uqaljay, mangtjez amen.
neka i tjemaq a nu vava a uqaljay, vaik anga sema vavua, tjitjumatjumaqu a kitjekaljava ta mangetjez timadju.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: kama i Puljaljuyan mangtjez sun?
sicuayan anga ku pinacunan tjanusun, nameqacanga sun.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: maleva ken aravac a pacun tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: ku sipavavay aicu a pangudralj tjanumun, pasa zuauanga ta pingsiang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: cuacuayanga inika mangtjengtjez, ku qaqivuav tiamadju a mapuljat ta keman.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: maya mavarung, nanguaq a temekel aken ta utja kaljavaljavari a sema pulaulangan.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: masalu ta su paiadja, uri vaik anga ken a cemikel.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: tjau papacain aicu a kuka, kacuanga cemikel ljenguaquanga keman.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: kicun aken tjanusun ta nutiav a masukincengelj ui?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ui, mecevung itjen izainu?
ecevungianga i gakku ui? uri seman iga men.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: sazuai i dradraiyanan numaya, uri penaiwanan aken.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: bulay aravac nu matelak a nia sakura i qinaljan, nu padjaljun anga tuazua pangtjezuanga kemim tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: nu maitazua ikiljaljava ta kaljaveveanang, kigemaljuanga!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: pangetjezua nu masalutanga numaya.
S.TRANSL: 那你小米收穫祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: ui!kitjekaljav ken numaya!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: akuazua lja cemikel sun a sema qinaljan a kikavaljutan.
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: uri cemikel aken a temulu.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: akuazua lja inika sun a sema lizuk a temulu?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: ayatua nasengelit aken tua ku qinaljan,na saljinga ken ta pasucikel tua ku picul ta qinaljan auta.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: macaqu sun aravac a tjemenun, tima na temalu tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: ku vuvu a vavayan, tjalja macaquan timadju a tjemenun i qinaljan tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: akuazua pasa kitulu sun ta tjemenun?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: nia kakudan a tjemenun,ulja nia sipatatavelak a nia kakudan aya ku kininemeneman.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: aicu a vinawa sanguaq aravac.
tiaken a na venawa.
macaqu sun aravac, a cuacuay a venawa tu aicu?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ini, kitjara tapulavayan, tja kesain anan a djuadjuai a paday katua paday,sa tja patatauden ata djulis, nu maitazua maqati anga pasa djilungen.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: anema su sipaveliveli?
izua silji katua luciau,tiaken a na temalem.
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: pida avelian nu cu a masanmusalj?
drusaiday saka lima puluq a penuljat.
tjengelay aken tu aicu a itung, pida a avelian?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: limaiday aicu.
pazangal aravac,a maqati a ljiatekeanan a kavelian?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: inika maqati, masipun aken nu patjaiteku anan.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: ui! avanazua a qacengecengal a ku veliyen.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: tjengelay aken tua aicu a siqunu katua padriyuk.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: drusa kuzulj a penuljat, tiaken a namalang, kicuacuay a su sicekaukau.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: ku sipasemalavan tua mareka kuqali tu veneli,a maqati a memadjulu anan.
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: ui, ku papemadjuluavanga.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: idu pacunu ta sipaveliveli a itung katua tjalupung.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: pida avelian na itung?
nu ita itung tjelu a iday saka lima puluq, nu tjelu kuzulj.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: veneli aken tu ita, pavai aken ta vaquan.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: djavadjavay, pasa veneli aken tua djuadjuay a paday katua vutjulj.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: mapuljatanga paday, izua anan a ciniyan a tjanaq,veneli sun?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ui, paveli aken tu ita, venelianga ken nu tjaivililj ta paday.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ui, ku pulubulubukay numaya, numaitucu lima puluq.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
